solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {_{k}_}2 \times _{j}_ = _{{2*pi_val*(k*Decimal('0.5'))*j}}_ cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= _{{2*pi_val*(k*Decimal('0.5'))*j}}_ cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in _{l}_ rolls \(= _{{2*pi_val*(k*Decimal('0.5'))*j}}_ \times _{l}_ = _{{2*l*pi_val*(k*Decimal('0.5'))*j}}_ cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is _{j}_ cm and its diameter is _{k}_ cm. While painting, the roller rolled over _{l}_ times completely. What surface area, in \(cm^2\), did Ram paint?
